instructions.1: Combine water and salt in saucepan; bring to a boil. Add couscous; cover and remove from heat. Allow to stand for 5 minutes.
instructions.2: Coarsely chop the garlic in a food processor. Add the mint and pulse until finely chopped. Add the chickpeas and remaining teaspoon salt and pulse until coarsely chopped.
instructions.3: Uncover the couscous and fluff with a fork.
instructions.4: In a large bowl, combine couscous, chickpea mixture, eggs, and lemon zest, mixing until well combined. Press the couscous mixture into a 1/4 measuring cup, smooth the top, and invert the measuring cup to release the cake onto a tray. Repeat with the remaining couscous mixture to make 8-9 cakes.
instructions.5: Refrigerate for 10-15 minutes to allow the mixture to set.
instructions.6: Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons oil in a large skillet over medium heat until simmering.
instructions.7: Add about 5 of the couscous cakes to the skillet; use a spatula to lightly flatten to about 3/4-inch thickness.
instructions.8: Cook, flipping once, until the patties are crisp and golden brown on both sides, about 3-5 minutes per side. Transfer the cooked patties to a paper and keep warm. Add the remaining 1 1/2 tablespoons olive oil to the skillet and cook the remaining cakes the same way.

questions.question: In Step 4, is the couscous from Step 1 being used?
Is couscous from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is skillet from Step 6 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is garlic from Step 2 still available in Step 6?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 1?
If we skip Step 1, is it still valid to uncover the couscous in Step 3?
Can we combine (Step 1) and uncover (Step 3) at the same time?
